questions.question:
Let Graph(x) be a predicate which denotes that x is a graph. Let Connected(x) be a predicate which denotes that x is connected. Which of the following first order logic sentences DOES NOT represent the statement: "Not every graph is connected"?

(GATE CSE 2007)

questions.question:
Which of the following is TRUE?

(GATE CSE 2007)
options:
A.

Every subset of a regular set is regular.

B.

Every finite subset of a non-regular set is regular.

C.

The union of two non-regular sets is not regular.

D.

Infinite union of finite sets is regular.
questions.correct_answer:
B.

Every finite subset of a non-regular set is regular.
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
In the 4B/5B encoding scheme, every 4 bits of data are encoded in a 5-bit codeword.
It is required that the codewords have at most 1 leading and at most 1 trailing zero.
How many are such codewords possible?

(GATE IT 2006)

questions.question:
Consider the depth-first-search of an undirected graph with 3 vertices P, Q, and R. Let discovery time d(u) represent the time instant when the vertex u is first visited, and finish time f(u) represent the time instant when the vertex u is last visited. Given that
\(\begin{array}{l|l}\hline \text{$d(P) = 5$ units } & \text{ $f(P) = 12$ units } \\\hline \text{$d(Q) = 6$ units} & \text{ $f(Q) = 10$ units} \\\hline \text{$d(R) = 14$ unit} & \text{$f(R) = 18$ units} \\\hline \end{array}\)
Which one of the following statements is TRUE about the graph?

(GATE IT 2006)
options:
B.

There are two connected components, and P and R are connected

C.

There are two connected components, and Q and R are connected

D.

There are two connected components, and P and Q are connected
questions.correct_answer:
D.

There are two connected components, and P and Q are connected
questions.explanation: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

questions.question:
Which of the following is the correct decomposition of the directed graph given below into its strongly connected components?



(GATE IT 2006)
options:
A.

\(\left \{ P, Q, R, S \right \}, \left \{ T \right \},\left \{ U \right \}, \left \{ V \right \}\)

B.

\(\left \{ P,Q, R, S, T, V \right \}, \left \{ U \right \}\)

C.

\(\left \{ P, Q, S, T, V \right \}, \left \{ R \right \},\left \{ U \right \}\)

D.

\(\left \{ P, Q, R, S, T, U, V \right \}\)
questions.correct_answer:
B.

\(\left \{ P,Q, R, S, T, V \right \}, \left \{ U \right \}\)

questions.question:
Let P, Q and R be sets, let \(\triangle \) denote the symmetric difference operator defined as \(P\triangle Q=(P \cup Q) - (P \cap Q)\). Using Venn diagrams, determine which of the following is/are TRUE?

I. \(P \Delta(Q \cap R)=(P \Delta Q) \cap(P \Delta R)\)
II. \(P \cap(Q \cap R)=(P \cap Q) \Delta(P \Delta R)\)

(GATE IT 2006)
